title: retro script
content:
From the CD Frank Sinatra The Best of the Capitol Years

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072319im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sinatra_3595.jpg)
author: tsb56

comments.content:
I think it's hand-lettered. The a's are not identical.

- Mike Yanega
Hand lettered? Hmmm.... anyone know of a font that is close?

It harkens back to the days of Maury Nemoy.

Michael
Not really close, but mimicks the feelings of this era: [Luxus Brut](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072319/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/phospho/luxus-brut/).

Michael, I have to ask – who is Maury Nemoy, and do you have any samples of his work?

- Mike Yanega

For something sort of similar, how about our own Mark Simonson's [Lakeside](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072319/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/lakeside/regular/characters.html), with the large titling caps (Script Guide sample below) ? Or else his [Kinescope](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072319/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/kinescope/). Both are based on film lettering from approximately the Sinatra era's early years.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072319im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lakeside-titling_4390.gif)
